author: potuz
content: <@602753420033785856> I was pointed to your <https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/pull/3447> pessimistic sync branch. I am very curious how do you recover from ELs that return ACCEPTED or SYNCING on non-canonical blocks when you call `notify_newPayload`?  I was thinking on disabling all optimistic sync paths (specially dealing with invalid blocks) on regular sync but keeping them on initial sync on prysm. But thought that a node that doesn't execute even a shallow fork will be offline until it reverts to init sync and then sync back up to head.

author: sproul
content:
My hope is that if the EL gets provided the same block _again_ via `notify_newPayload` then it will return `VALID`. So the flow would be something like:

1. CL gets the re-org block on gossip, sends it to the EL
2. EL says SYNCING
3. Pessimistic CL stops importing the block
4. CL sees other peers with that block as head (or attestations to that block), and requests it via RPC
5. CL provides the block to the EL and it returns VALID
6. Block is head now, forkchoiceUpdated proceeds as normal

The potential slow part is step 4, which almost guarantees that validators attached to the CL will miss head on that slot. This might be an acceptable trade-off for now, or could be accelerated by trying to cache the payload explicitly for this purpose. It would be kind of nice if the EL had a callback for when it finished syncing ðŸ˜… 

As I mentioned in the PR description this is also guaranteed not to work with any EL that doesn't process forks on `newPayload`, i.e. Erigon.
